contentrichtext.text: '''Buechel''' is a former [[census-designated place]] in [[Jefferson County, Kentucky|Jefferson County]], [[Kentucky]], [[United States]]. The population was 7,272 at the 2000 census. In 2003, The area was [[annexed]] to the city of [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville]] due to a merger between the city and Jefferson County's [[unincorporated area]]s. Buechel is now a [[neighborhood]] within the city limits of [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville]]. It is named after John Buechel, a [[Swiss]] carpenter and tavern owner who established a post office at his White Cottage tavern in 1883, ==Geography== Buechel is located at {{coord|38.1951|-85.6519|type:city|format=dms|display=inline,title}}.{{GR|1}} According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of 6.5 km² (2.5 mi²), all land. ==Demographics== {{USCensusPop | 1970=5359 | 1980=6912 | 1990=7081 | 2000=7272 | footnote=source:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.census.gov/prod/www/abs/decennial/index.html |title=CENSUS OF POPULATION AND HOUSING (1790-2000) |publisher=[[U.S. Census Bureau]] |accessdate=2010-07-18}}</ref> }} As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 7,272 people, 3,320 households, and 1,792 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 1,114.2/km² (2,890.9/mi²). There were 3,505 housing units at an average density of 537.0/km² (1,393.3/mi²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 76.43% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 17.86% [[African American (U.S. Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.23% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1.42% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.01% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 2.31% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.73% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 4.07% of the population. There were 3,320 households out of which 25.8% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 36.9% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 13.6% had a female householder with no husband present, and 46.0% were non-families. 39.4% of all households were made up of individuals and 14.3% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.15 and the average family size was 2.88. In the CDP the population was spread out with 22.4% under the age of 18, 9.4% from 18 to 24, 31.8% from 25 to 44, 19.7% from 45 to 64, and 16.7% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 36 years. For every 100 females there were 91.4 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 87.0 males. The median income for a household in the CDP was $35,650, and the median income for a family was $43,375. Males had a median income of $31,376 versus $24,604 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $19,426. About 5.5% of families and 7.8% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 9.7% of those under age 18 and 8.9% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> ==External links== *[http://orig.courier-journal.com/reweb/community/placetime/midcounty-buechel.html "Buechel: Predatory Animals Were Ousted, but Wild Life Lived on in a Defiant Rustler, Bashford Manor Thoroughbreds"] — Article by Bill Pike of ''[[The Courier-Journal]]'' {{Geographic Location | title = '''Places in [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville Metro]]''' | Northwest = | North = [[Hikes Point, Louisville|Hikes Point]] | Northeast = | West = [[West Buechel, Kentucky|West Buechel]] | Center = Buechel | East = [[Jeffersontown, Kentucky|Jeffersontown]] | Southwest = | South = [[Newburg, Louisville|Newburg]] | Southeast = }}<br style="line-height: 8px;"/>{{Louisville neighborhoods}} {{Louisville}} [[Category:Neighborhoods in Louisville, Kentucky]] [[Category:Former census-designated places in Kentucky]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1883]]
